header.topics: ANON's daughter's new job in publishing; IT work; management consultancy. Holiday trips (travel agent for a big trip? Pre-booking accommodation or not). Retirement and semi-retirement: effect on other partner, role change(s), children living at home, what to do when reaching retirement. Keeping up with friends: organised socialising on a monthly basis (wives meeting in one pub, males in another pub every first Friday of the month at lunchtime).
header.activity: Friends talking about Jobs, Holiday Trips, Thoughts on Retirement and Socialising, over a glass of wine.

no no he's given up he's sixty and decided well he absolutely hated the last contract that he did he really really really hated that it so he finished that and decided that he he didn't want to go back to Lloyds ever again he really didn't wanna do that he I think he'd be happy to do something and use his skills but not doing what he was doing under the pressure he was under and the politics what he really likes doing is right he he used to be the way that that the bank worked was that you'd be a project manager and you'd be responsible for ot I don't know ten twelve million pound project but it was a project you sort of had a start beginning and end and it and it had a sort of boundary round it and that's what you were delivering and that's where he was really good at that and he'd always deliver really well on that but they've changed the whole way it works now so that this project will be involved with this project that's involved in that project so the whole things are running together as one sort of programme and what was happening was that erm he'd spend half the week reporting on what he's supposed to deliver that week to the fol to the following week into this into this group thing and he said you know all I was doing was spending all my time reporting and I couldn't actually get the work done
mm

and and it was constant politics and somebody you know lording it over each he just he just I can't deal with it now sorry I want to deliver a project and I know I can I'm good at that I can do do that but I can't deal with all this playing around bit telling people what I'm gonna deliver but I haven't got time to do it because I'm spending all my time reporting and what I'm gonna deliver and that sort of you know ridiculous thing so in the end erm so he's given up I think if someth he'd love to do something else part time but nothing's come along

yeah in theory and we need updating the kitchen actually so he's been doing a lot of work on that it's quite a difficult transition actually I find it quite difficult with him being at home and me going out to work so there are times where it's quite stressful and other times it makes it easier so I wouldn't say it's always plain sailing so it varies really you can get quite resentful on occasions and I don't like that side of myself
